issues.description: The problem statement (UML) specifies getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): double, but the solution implementation declares and returns an int (public int getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor()). This causes a type/signature mismatch and also leads to integer division (loss of fractional students per tutor) which contradicts the specified return type in the exercise. Students following the UML will implement/expect a double, while the provided solution uses int, which can confuse students and cause test/autograder mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the implementation match the UML/specification by changing the method signature and computation to return a double. For example: public double getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() { return (double) getTotalNumberOfStudents() / getNumberOfTutors(); } (Also update template/sample code accordingly so students see the correct return type.)
